The Surfin' Burrito
Donkeys & Diners

The Client

The Surfin' Burrito is a world-famous burrito stand in the heart of sunny Cancun, Mexico.

The Challenge

To come up with a new take on their lovable surfing donkey mascot ahead of Guy Fieri's 'Diners, Drive-ins, & Dives' coming in to do a TV segment.

My Role

  • Character Design
  • Logo Design
  • Merchandise

My Tools

  • Hand Drawing
  • Adobe Photoshop
  • Adobe Illustrator

Initial Sketches

We agreed on the concept of something that mixed cute doggy character packaging we often see in the aisles with something a little serene and worthy of the ZenDog title.

Tightening Pencils

I came up with a few tighter pencils. They liked these a lot, but for the central image wanted sometihng easier to read from far away. So I went back to the drawing board!

Another pass at the art

I decided to whip out the 'ol Wacom tablet and do a digital version of the art. This was a lot easier to read from far away, and they loved it. With that, I went right to the next step.

Final Art

I finished inking and coloringin Adobe Illustrator. I find using Illustrator for business related mascots makes for a really clean look that's easy to read.

Showtime!

With the art done, we rushed to get a t-shirt printed to be ready for Guy Fiera and his popular cooking show Diners, Drive-ins, & Dives! Check it out yourself, it's Season 26, Episode 6.
